page.title: 04 Fauna and Reclamation
page.content: {Fauna} Grey squirrel, fox, badger, rabbit, shrew, mole, weasel, stoat, toad,frog, adder,grass snake and slow worm are present here. Buzzard, sparrow hawk, kestrel, owl, woodpecker, tree-creeper, jay, magpie, pigeon, goldcrest, spotted flycatcher, collared dove, a variety of tits and finches live here. Most common songbirds and jackdaws are found near houses. {Reclamation} There are many disused lead mines in the area. The spoil tips from one of these near Lake Geirionydd has caused seepage into the lake which is now "dead". Under E.E.C. auspices these tips are being reclaimed by the use of special grass seed from Canada.
